decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful Aggro strategy with the combination of the Partner commanders Rowan and Will Kenrith in a Duel Commander format. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and aggressive, putting early pressure on opponents while controlling the board with counterspells and removal spells. The inclusion of powerful cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Ral, Izzet Viceroy, and Chandra, Torch of Defiance provide additional win conditions and card advantage. The deck also utilizes extra turn spells like Temporal Mastery and Time Warp to maintain tempo and outpace opponents. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and spells while maintaining control of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption cards while setting up card advantage through card draw and planeswalker abilities. Aminatou, the Fateshifter's ability to manipulate the top of the library is utilized to ensure drawing into powerful spells and staying ahead in the game. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by leveraging powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate card advantage and control the board. Additionally, the deck includes synergies like Parallax Tide and Palace Jailer to further control the game and maintain dominance on the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck featuring The Gitrog Monster is to assemble a powerful combo involving cards like Dark Ritual, Gitrog Monster, and Dakmor Salvage. By utilizing various land recursion effects and card draw abilities, the deck aims to generate a large amount of value and eventually win the game through a massive burst of mana and card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Life from the Loam, Crucible of Worlds, and Ramunap Excavator allows for consistent land recursion, while cards like Dark Petition and Demonic Tutor help find the necessary combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells to control the game until it can assemble its combo and emerge victorious.

The main theme of this deck is to utilize the graveyard and sacrifice effects to assemble combos and generate value. The deck includes various cards that allow for reanimation, such as Animate Dead and Necromancy, as well as sacrifice outlets like Phyrexian Tower and Demonic Tutor. By utilizing Iname, Death Aspect as the commander, the deck can quickly fill the graveyard with creatures to be reanimated or sacrificed for beneficial effects. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Duress to help control the game and ensure the combo pieces can be assembled smoothly. Overall, the deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard and sacrificing creatures to achieve a powerful and synergistic game plan.

The deck revolves around aggression and utilizing the goblin tribe to overwhelm opponents with a fast and relentless onslaught of creatures. Grenzo, Dungeon Warden serves as the commander, enabling you to put goblins directly into play from the bottom of your library. The deck includes a wide variety of goblin creatures, providing a diverse and powerful army to attack and apply pressure. Cards like Goblin Chieftain and Goblin Warchief boost the power of your goblin creatures, while cards like Goblin Bombardment and Goblin Sledder offer utility and ways to deal additional damage. With a mix of efficient removal spells and tribal synergies, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory through aggressive tactics.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize aggressive tactics with a focus on graveyard recursion and creature synergy. By utilizing cards like Grim Flayer, Tarmogoyf, Vengevine, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures. The deck includes various cards to support this strategy, such as Survival of the Fittest, Fauna Shaman, and Traverse the Ulvenwald for tutoring creatures, as well as spell disruption like Thoughtseize and Duress. The mana base is designed to support a fast and consistent ramp, with a mix of lands and mana accelerants like Birds of Paradise and Elves of Deep Shadow to ensure quick deployment of threats and disruption.

The deck revolves around using artifacts and thopter tokens to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while also maintaining a high level of aggression. It focuses on generating value through cards like Sai, Master Thopterist, Urza, Lord High Artificer, and Tezzeret the Seeker, as well as powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Skullclamp. The deck utilizes various artifacts and artifact synergies to gain incremental advantages and outvalue the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like counterspells and land destruction to keep the opponent on the back foot. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient threats and disruptive plays to secure victory.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, bounce spells, and extra turn effects to disrupt the opponent's plans and build up massive card advantage. With Will Kenrith as the commander, the deck can take advantage of extra mana and card draw to consistently outpace the opponent. By utilizing a wide array of spells like Force of Will, Time Warp, and Cryptic Command, this deck aims to stay ahead on board presence and card advantage while stalling the opponent's game plan. The goal is to eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and win the game through sheer control and tempo advantage.

The deck revolves around using a variety of small creatures, mana ramp, and graveyard recursion to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats. By utilizing cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for its aggressive strategy. The inclusion of cards like Survival of the Fittest and Fauna Shaman allows for additional consistency and toolbox options, ensuring that the deck can adapt to different situations and find the necessary answers to seal the victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive, fast-paced gameplay with a heavy emphasis on dealing direct damage to the opponent. The strategy revolves around quickly deploying low-cost, high-impact creatures and burn spells to chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck includes a variety of efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Flame Slash, as well as creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear that can deal damage quickly. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Hell's Thunder and Chandra, Fire of Kaladesh for additional reach and versatility in dealing damage.

This deck focuses on utilizing the lifegain abilities of Karlov of the Ghost Council to build up a powerful board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy. It includes a mix of removal spells, protection for Karlov, and lifegain creatures to trigger his ability. The deck also includes card advantage and tutoring effects to ensure that the player has access to the necessary cards to control the game and come out on top in one-on-one duels. Additionally, it features equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance Karlov's abilities and provide additional ways to deal damage and gain life.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing the Partner commanders Kraum and Tymna, the deck can generate card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck includes a variety of disruptive spells such as Counterspell, Thoughtseize, and Spell Pierce to control the game and protect its threats. With a diverse mana base including fetch lands and dual lands, the deck can consistently cast its spells and ensure a smooth curve of threats. By combining strong creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Monastery Mentor with powerful spells like Cryptic Command and Demonic Tutor, the deck seeks to apply relentless pressure and outmaneuver opponents in one-on-one matchups.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing creatures and buffing them with spells and abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes a mix of efficient creatures, mana dorks, and powerful spells like Berserk and Collected Company to put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Questing Beast as the commander adds additional power and utility to the deck, allowing for evasion and dealing with opposing blockers. The goal is to apply early pressure, maintain board presence with efficient creatures, and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck's strategy is to be fast, efficient, and relentless in its pursuit of victory through combat damage.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between the partner commanders Kraum and Reyhan to create a fast-paced aggressive playstyle. With a mix of efficient removal spells, powerful creatures, and disruptive cards, the goal is to control the board while steadily applying pressure to the opponent. The deck includes a variety of versatile creatures like Tarmogoyf, True-Name Nemesis, and Questing Beast, along with cards like Fatal Push, Abrupt Decay, and Lightning Bolt for efficient removal. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Chandra, Torch of Defiance adds another layer of versatility and threat to the deck, making it a formidable force in one-on-one Commander matches.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing the partner commanders Will Kenrith and Rowan Kenrith to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while also having access to a wide range of control spells to protect its strategy. It includes efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to deal damage to the opponent's creatures or life total, along with powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command to disrupt opposing plays. The deck also features extra turn spells like Time Warp and Temporal Manipulation to gain extra advantage and close out games quickly. By combining aggressive creatures with efficient removal and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in the 1 vs 1 format of Duel Commander.

This deck revolves around utilizing Zur the Enchanter to search for and play powerful enchantments that control the game. The deck includes a variety of control spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also having powerful reanimation targets like Emrakul, the Promised End and Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite. The deck aims to stall the game with counterspells and removal until it can play its game-winning creatures. The key strategy is to use Zur's ability to search for specific enchantments that enhance the deck's control elements and provide additional win conditions. The deck's versatility and ability to adapt to different situations make it a challenging and strategic deck to pilot.
